Job Title: Senior Communications Specialist

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Career Area

Communications

Job Description

 Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

 Cat Digital is the digital and technology arm of Caterpillar Inc., leveraging the latest technologies to build industry leading digital solutions for our customers and dealers. With over 1.5 million connected assets worldwide, our teams use data, technology, advanced analytics, telematics and AI capabilities to help our customers build a better, more sustainable world. 

Job Summary

Creates and delivers communications content for audiences that include Cat dealers; participates in the planning and execution of communications programs within the Cat Digital organization.

What You Will Do

 Developing and distributing content for dealer communication channels, including catdealer.com, presentations, newsletters, and Sharepoint sites.  Collaborating with internal stakeholders and advising on the suitability of approaches for communication efforts targeting Cat dealers with a clear and consistent Cat Digital brand message.  Communicating with effectiveness and confidence; building strong working relationships with dealers and internal business partners to drive continuous improvements.  Gathering strategic insights on the dealer experience; designing communications plans with this journey / experience in mind.  Tracking and analyzing metrics to measure the effectiveness of these communications on catdealer.com and other digital channels, then reporting the results. 

What You Will Have

 Strong writing ability and proven experience creating and delivering communications content across a variety of platforms, including websites, newsletters, SharePoint sites and presentations.  Extensive experience ensuring stakeholders, such as dealers, are informed of the communications content and tools that are available to them.  Expertise to proactively align messaging and communications with corporate brand standards while helping establish and communicate a consistent brand message.  Proven ability in collecting Voice of Customer, Stakeholder or Dealer feedback to understand their needs, struggles, and end goals.  Extensive experience developing and delivering change management and communication plans for internal and/or external audiences.  Ability to explain the impact of interactions with stakeholders, which may include business partners and dealers.  Building relationships and mapping dealer journeys to deliver a continuous communications improvement cycle and the ability to measure and report progress.  Collaborates well with cross-departmental associates and management, engendering trust and partnership. 

Additional Details

 This position must be based out of our Chicago, IL; Peoria, IL or Dallas, TX office with a flexible hybrid work environment.  #BI (used to post on Built In) 

 Working with a Fortune 100 leader, you can build your career on a global scale and take advantage of development opportunities with emerging technologies. We’ve created an inclusive environment for you to explore your passions, make an impact and do the work that really matters. Join Us. 

Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.

Posting Dates

April 15, 2024 - April 21, 2024

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.

EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .

Experience Level (if available): None
